data.title: Company Overview & News
data.meta_description: Umicore engages in the materials technology business. It operates through the following business segments: Catalysis, Energy & Surface Technologies, Recycling,
data.text:
Elon Musk’s xAI Launches New Grok-2 Model That Allows Users To Generate Images Of Politicians And Copyrighted Brands

Some users testing Grok-2's new AI image generation tools highlighted its looser restrictions by sharing fake images of political leaders wielding guns and consuming drugs.

Golf, Art Fans Drawn To Pennsylvania Resort Fresh Off $500 Million Upgrade

Fine art and photogenic fairways share equal billing at Nemacolin, a resort in the Laurel Highlands where dozens of sculptures pop up along a pair of Pete Dye courses.

UFC 305 Fight Card Preview, Odds And Predictions: Kara-France Vs. Erceg

Everything you need to know about the flyweight fight between Kai Kara-France and Steve Erceg on Saturday's UFC 305 PPV fight card.

L.L. Bean Continues To Expand Its National Footprint, Totaling 60 Stores This Year

Despite being a well-known and loved brand, L.L. Bean has an "out of sight, out of mind" problem. Its growing fleet of stores now in 19 states in intended to fix it.

This Kinder, Gentler Bill Collector Is Helping People Keep The Lights On

Phaedra Ellis-Lamkins built Promise into a $520 million powerhouse by helping municipalities and utilities collect unpaid bills with zero-interest payment plans.

Hamby Pregnancy Lawsuit Against WNBA, Aces Presents Many Legal Issues

Hamby’s allegations have at least some merit since the WNBA previously disciplined the Aces and head coach Becky Hammon. Yet, Hamby’s damages are very uncertain.

Laser Headlamps Are Disappearing. Here’s Why.

The night-beating technology race, which saw a fierce battle between Audi and BMW to be first to market with laser-powered headlights, is over.

CrowdStrike Accepts Most Epic Fail Award While Denying Delta Liability

Acceptance of the Pwnie Most Epic Fail award has earned CrowdStrike kudos. The company’s response to Delta Air Lines’ $500 million suit has been far less amenable.

This Could Be FC Barcelona’s Next Sale, Reports Sky Italia

FC Barcelona could already be lining up its next multimillion dollar sale according to reports from Spain and Italy.

As ManUnited Sign De Ligt, Bayern Mourn The Player He Could Have Been

Matthijs de Ligt signed for Manchester United after just two years in the Bundesliga. At Bayern, de Ligt was a promise for the future rather than a pillar of the present.

Li Ka-Shing’s CK Group Adds $450 Million U.K. Wind Farms To Energy Portfolio Amid Shopping Spree

The deal marks CK Infrastructure’s third energy acquisition so far this year.

Pierre Kalulu: Why Juventus Made AC Milan Defender A Transfer Target

After missing out on Calafiori & Todibo, Juventus needed a defender who fits Thiago Motta's tactical approach.

Trump Blames Tech Issues For His ‘Strange’ Voice In X Interview As He Thanks Elon Musk For ‘Strong Endorsement’

Earlier on Tuesday, Trump had lashed out against media outlets for highlighting X’s technical issues instead of his two-and-a-half-hour-long chat with Musk.

Real Madrid Versus Atalanta UEFA Super Cup Line Up And Preview

Real Madrid can become the most successful team of all time in the UEFA Super Cup if it beats Atalanta in Warsaw on Wednesday.

Dana White Tells Released Fighter: ‘You Put Yourself In This Position’

No matter what Muhammad Mokaev says to the media or on X, UFC President Dana White wants to make sure everyone knows the discarded flyweight brought it all on himself.
